result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brook M Pommerening

records.addlTxt:
9:56 AM cases 22CM784, 22CM846 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brook M Pommerening, in custody not brought over.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Brook M Pommerening. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/14/2022 at 2:00 PM
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am. 

Not mailed as address indicates "Homeless".

(Case called at 11:49 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Brook Pommerening appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $500 cash bond. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $250 cash bond with various conditions. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/03/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 10/24/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with Motel 6 on Craig Road, N.R., D.B.
No violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances.
